metadata.name: New Kernel Driver Via SC.EXE
metadata.comment: Detects creation of a new service (kernel driver) with the type "kernel"

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\sc.exe')) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('create')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('config'))) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('binpath')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('type')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('kernel')))

output.summary: Detects creation of a new service (kernel driver) with the type "kernel"

metadata.objective: False positive: Rare legitimate installation of kernel drivers via sc.exe Reference: https://www.aon.com/cyber-solutions/aon_cyber_labs/yours-truly-signed-av-driver-weaponizing-an-antivirus-driver/
